website_summaries.verdict: The overall quality and roominess of this tent make it an outstanding choice, but it might not be the best option to pitch on rocky surfaces,
pros: Comes in olive green or coyote tan
Stands up well to windy conditions
Quite roomy inside for a 1-person tent, with good ventilation
Easy to set up and take down
cons: The tent isn't freestanding, so you'll need to use the tent pegs, which are thin and very sharp

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TENT!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this both motorbike camping/traveling as well as hunting, and it is a dang good tent. I should have bought one a long time ago. Well worth the money and easy to set up. I am 6'1" and 200 pounds and I had no siiues as far as being too small. A fair amount of room up front to bring in your boots, socks, a small light, etc. Having used a half dozen other one man tents and bivys in the last decade, I will say this is the best yet.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mcintyre

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the light weight adventurer!
customer_reviews.text: I own several one man tents and they all function great as does the ionosphere, it does have a slight learning curve over my other tents as far as the entrance goes, I am 6’ 250 lbs. and have to go in feet first, also I have to be outside of the tent to get dressed, undressed, etc. but that is what I expected on this much lighter and smaller tent that is definitely worth it at its price point! I just got back from a three day two night in January where we experienced a low of 8 degrees Fahrenheit and a brisk wind all through one night and it did great!
customer_reviews.author: DC-Outdoors

customer_reviews.title: Good for cold weather too.
customer_reviews.text: I used this tent on a 32 degree night and it seemed to hold in heat well. It has an open design to let air flow under the rain fly. You can stake the fly closer to the main tent then push leaves around the bottom to close up the air space in cold weather. I used a snugpak softie elite 3 bag and snugpak fleece liner and was super comfy. I'm 6' tall and 175 pounds. I had enough space to squeeze in some of my gear and shoes around me so they were dry the next morning.
customer_reviews.author: T Pick

customer_reviews.title: Fits in a 34L Molle Pack
customer_reviews.text: I was putting together a very lightweight kit for a few days in the mountains and this Ionosphere fits nicely into a 34L Molle bugout pack (  ). It fits in the main compartment (easier with the poles packed separately) along with an air pad, ultralight bivvy sleep-sack, stove, fuel and cord (for food storage etc.), extra alloy pegs and footprint. The mid compartment holds the food (and hanging sack), the outer lower compartment has socks and essentials and the outer upper compartment has emergency kit.
customer_reviews.author: David C. Rose

customer_reviews.title: ... trip in the BWCA in MN and it was easy set up and tear down
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 5 day camping trip in the BWCA in MN and it was easy set up and tear down. I'm 5'10 and had plenty of head room to store my gear in the tent with me. Love this tent cant wait to take it out again.
customer_reviews.author: Gamerdjc

customer_reviews.title: Ionosphere by snugpak (great use for military)
customer_reviews.text: The ionosphere by snugpak work great in the field. I used a few weeks ago when the weather was nasty with rain and winds and this tent exceed my expectations. It had enough room for my sleeping bag, my duffle bag and gear. I was able to perform personal hygiene with some creativity but I was able to get it done inside the tent. The only issue that I encountered was that the ground were I set up my tent was a little bit hard and some of the stakes bent, not too much but it made me realize that I should probably get some extra heavy duty stakes.
customer_reviews.author: GONZO

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used in the desert last week with sustained 40Kt. wind all day, and held fast!
customer_reviews.author: william machado

customer_reviews.title: Roomy, durable, waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: Used this tent on a 7 day solo hike on the Appalachian Trail. Extremely durable but light weight. Packs into a small pouch. Is very rain resistant. Great quality cheap 4 seasons tent. Quite roomy as well. I'm 6'1" 215 lbs it fit me and my oversized pack, all my gear, and had plenty of room.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Great little tent with very quick set-up
customer_reviews.text: Great little tent with very quick set-up. Not a ton of work room, but as a quick shelter from the bugs and elements, it pretty much rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Flappy Cheeks

customer_reviews.title: Great for low profile camping.
customer_reviews.text: I bought thus to use while camping in the high desert where trees are not so plentiful (i usually hammock camp). It is relatively light weight and can be set up with ease. Materials and construction are solid, and haven't experienced any tears, breaks, leaks as of yet. The low profile design is great for convealing yourself if you wish to remain 'stealthy'.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Cody Barton

customer_reviews.title: Best all around bivy/tent
customer_reviews.text: i really like this product. the fabric is strong enough where i wont feel like ill damage it easily and it keeps the persperation from your breath to roll down i felt well ventilated and warm in 25°F. it is easy to set up after a little practice and it fits compact and is only about 3lbs or so. its the best tent ive used. i wish however it had a vestibule which can be remedied with using a small tarp connecting a tree or 2 to the lines on top of the bivytent for some cooking. this is a great all around tent that my girlfriend really enjoyed setting up and sitting in to see if I was right
customer_reviews.author: Adam Y

customer_reviews.title: QC Missed my Unit.
customer_reviews.text: I own and use many Snugpak products and have never had a single issue of quality or durability. Sadly, this was my first unsatisfactory product from Snugpak. Soon first set up for inspection I noticed numerous areas in the tub, below the seam, with stitching holes (from needle punctures). Light was clearly visible and the holes numbered between 20 and 30. While they may not have leaked, their proximity created a perforated area which made me question durability. From my prior Snugpak experience and the majority of reviews here, it's obvious QC was a bit lacking on my Unit.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, well made and I would buy it again!
customer_reviews.text: When rolled up it is very small and light weight, great for a small tent without spending 500+ $ on a ultralight weigh tent This thing is worth every penny. I am 5'11" 205lbs and I fit with my entire pack and sleeping system with plenty of room on the sides and by my head and feet. The spot where you get in i stage gear to dry right their and it works great. When you open it up and look at it you will be pleased with the build quality. If anything happened to mine now I would not hesitate to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Surrell

customer_reviews.title: Great Shelter for multiple environments
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product as an upgrade from using a tarp for shelter when camping. Provides great protection from the elements and is quick to setup. Used in weather ranging from 30 degrees to 95 degrees Fahrenheit. Very intuitive to setup and break down. Weight and size is acceptable for back packing. After setup, the room within the tent is big enough to store small-medium sized pack/ruck sack, boots, and additional equipment. Can be used with a sleeping pad for additional comfort or insulation when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Manny B.

customer_reviews.title: Great design. Compact and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Great design. Compact and easy to set up. Good for backpackers who doesn't do a lot of personal grooming or other activities inside their tents. I have another tent that I can sit up without straining my back but that one is heavier. So this would be a great tent if you need to be mobile all the time. I highly recommend this tent for its simplicity, construction and compactness.
customer_reviews.author: wayne

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tent!
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up, blends into environment nicely and holds up excellently in inclement weather even though it's so lightweight. Surprisingly roomy (I'm 6ft and me and my gear/dog fit fine) plus great ventilation on this one as well! Seriously no complaints. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice even for a big guy
customer_reviews.text: Very nice even for a big guy. Im 6 foot , 220 lbs . My son and i hiked 15 miles at big bend in one day and it rained. No, it poured the first night.! I kept nice and dry even when a pool of water ended up under my tent at night. Lots of stakes, but needed them with the wind that howled that night. Great job snugpak!
customer_reviews.author: Neal S

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't get any better than this
customer_reviews.text: This tent is awesome! My buddy and I unpacked our tents and set them up in his yard. He was not happy with his purchase to say the least. He looked over at my ionosphere, nodded his head and said, "yup, I'm getting one of those". This thing went up so quick and easy, it is so worth the money I paid for it. And it's so light it will be a breeze carrying on he trail. By the way he bought the spitfire 1. What an odd looking tent. It was high at the center so you could sit up in it but you almost have to sleep in a fetal position.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Very good tent
customer_reviews.text: Very awesome tent. The first trip out it rained like crazy. I was perfectly dry sleeping inside. It is pretty sturdy and easy to set up. Only complaint is it is a bit tricky getting in to and out of. The opening is pretty small in comparison to other tents. Also don't count on the straps on the case to secure the tent to your pack, they easily come loose.
customer_reviews.author: Virtual Troy

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars and a tip for other owners
customer_reviews.text: Well, plenty of good reviews for this, I'll add my five stars as well. However, I also have a tip. Since there is no foot print for this, I tried something else. I ordered the Nemo Equipment 2011 Obi 2-Person Tent Footprint.It's not quite perfect for the Ionosphere, but darn close. It's wide enough and just a tad bit short, but not by much. Make sure if you do this, you get the two person tent footprint, not the 1 person one.
customer_reviews.author: Oldwolfe

customer_reviews.title: Great, small tent.
customer_reviews.text: Its not the quickest to put up and doesnt come with a footprint, however it stood up to several storms on my WVa camping trip in May. Fit nicely inside my kayak and gave me a dry, bug free place to sleep at night. The main issue i have is that you almost need 2 people to put it up because the poles are not free standing. It takes a bit of practice to get right, and thankfully I set it up at home before I went on the trip.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B.

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Just received it and set it up. Easy to do. It's actually a pretty wide tent and I bet in an emergency you could put another person in there if you slept sideways. I'm 6'1 medium frame so for me it's more than enough space to accommodate myself and a pack plus my rifle. The floor seems fairly thin so I'll buy a floor saver. I subtract a star for having to buy that and carry the extra weight.
customer_reviews.author: SweetPotato

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, easy to set up and pack up, light and compact for long hunts
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad a** tent
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this tent for three years or so and it’s still holding up fine! I’ve taken it to some extreames with no problem. It’s been great on mountain peaks in the Adirondacks, in a blizzard on the continental divide and in the Southern California desert.. Very durable and long lasting I’d for sure recommend this tent hands down!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Rowand

customer_reviews.title: I'm 6'6" tall and actually fit inside here. Sitting ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'6" tall and actually fit inside here. Sitting up inside is not happening but I can certainly stretch out.
customer_reviews.author: LBKewee

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: Very lite to carry and the right color. Could be used for winter if you go around the outside bottom and block off some of the venting maybe with some leaves or such. Not free standing but not an issue when you can drive stakes/pins into ground. Could shelter 2 smaller people in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bombproof
customer_reviews.text: Awesome 1 man bivy tent. Bombproof Snugpak construction and versatility make this a super functional and fun tent
customer_reviews.author: " Chesapeake "

customer_reviews.title: The last tent I’ll ever buy.
customer_reviews.text: There is no need to look elsewhere, this tent is the best. It’ll fit you & all your gear inside with no problem while being light enough to pack & small enough to be inconspicuous. It’s awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Loni Holmes

customer_reviews.title: A super decent bivvy
customer_reviews.text: A super decent bivvy. If you've never slept in one before it takes a little getting used to. But there's room in here for me and my pack. It's a nice lightweight, cheaper solution for hiking and I'm glad I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MacGruber

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight system
customer_reviews.text: Great little bivvy tent. For those used to bivvy life... this is a great upgrade. For those used to camping tents this may feel a bit tight. I took this on a mountain trip to the Catskills in winter - the tent took me through -13C weather. Just used some fir branches to fill the gap at the base of the outer. Overall great value, super light. Stored it on top of my 37liter pack no drama.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light 1 person tent for bicycle backpacker.👍🏻
customer_reviews.text: For the people looking for a light,durably made 1 person tent for backpacking THIS is IT.Just the right amount of room for me and my gear.Glad I chose this for bicycle backpack travel.Highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Louis A.Aloi

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, a bit hard to get into and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great tent, a bit hard to get into and out of but very nice, fits up to a 6 foot person with no problem. NOTE; The company does NOT make a ground sheet for this product.
customer_reviews.author: officermcbride

customer_reviews.title: great solo tent
customer_reviews.text: Tested out this piece of equipment in a rainstorm with the temperature near freezing. Condensation did develop on the floor of the tent but with my sleeping pad I was able to stay dry. I'm 5'5" and found the tent to be very spacious. However I did start to feel claustrophobic when my 60 lb dog joined me. Tent was very quick to disassemble and pack up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tent and durable. Like everything about it however Did not come with a repair kit as advertised. Tried reaching out to company but no luck with response. Hope they can help me with this.
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: Packs small and lightweight.Great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Gave it to my son the scout for Christmas.Packs small and wonderfully light weight .What's better is that on his first outing with his tent he managed to leave behind the tents outer bag(it was raining and he stuffed the tent into his duffle bag,no tent bag). The guy at snugpac must also have a 13 year old because he sent a replacement bag no charge. That's the kind of service that will me bring back again
customer_reviews.author: R. Darby

customer_reviews.title: I love the tent design
customer_reviews.text: I love the tent design. It's a little bit of a tight fit inside (as far as maneuvering goes), but what's to be expected for having a low profile setup like this. But I really wish they used a more durable fabric though, at least around the zippers. I feel that you might tear the fabric if it gets caught in the zipper if you were in a rush to get in or out. Other than that, I would buy it again if need be.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: I tried it out recently to get a feel for it and i do like it; it is light weight
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent for a backpacking trip abroad. I tried it out recently to get a feel for it and i do like it; it is light weight, packable, and good quality. The size is just right and quick to set up and take down. The only problem i have is that the stakes are a bit to fragile. I already bent 3 of them trying to put them in the ground. Yes, the ground was not mud soft but was rock hard.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny S.

customer_reviews.title: Careful with the zipper
customer_reviews.text: Was extremely satisfied with the overall construction and assembly, however the zipper on the rain cover broke (teeth misalignment) and unfortunately was followed by a few days of rain. Would purchase again if the zippers were stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact
customer_reviews.text: Very compact and lightweight. I've used it for a motorcycle trip and it was very easy to set up and take down. It kept the wind off me and kept me comfortable (with a good sleeping bag of course) in 40 degree weather. I can't comment on its long term durability, but it seems to be pretty well made.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Davis

customer_reviews.title: Although there is no room for a pack or to sit up comfortably this is a great single person tent
customer_reviews.text: Wish it was a fly first tent and that is why I gave it four stars. Although there is no room for a pack or to sit up comfortably this is a great single person tent.
customer_reviews.author: David Holloway

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for the price will do what its designed for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everything is hit or miss. This one is out of the park!!👍
customer_reviews.text: Just got my ionosphere today. Fast shipping. No issues out of the box. Aside from a field test. Tent is perfect. I'm 6 feet tall and have more than enough room. I highly recommend. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Ionosphere tent
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be a very well made tent. I'm 6' tall and 225 pounds and seem to have room inside for me and my gear. It is a one person tent so theres not much room to move around after gear is inside but hey its a place to sleep out of the elements. It's very compact and fits on my pack without being to obtrusive.
customer_reviews.author: DAKOTA

customer_reviews.title: A well-built little tent. Used it 3 times now. No complaints.
customer_reviews.text: A well-built and compact little tent. Used it 3 times now.
customer_reviews.author: Mikhail Kabakov

customer_reviews.title: Love my tent ! Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: Great product nice to air for a day before using it .
customer_reviews.author: Shane H.

customer_reviews.title: It is a very light weight tent with a great deal of room for a one-man
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit complicated to set up, but the tent performs very well in every aspect...including driving rain. It is by no means a winter tent due to the fact the main body of the tent is all made of a mess material...and the gaps between the tent and the fly are quite drafty. It is a very light weight tent with a great deal of room for a one-man. All things being equal...I'm pretty impressed with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tent.
customer_reviews.text: A great light weight tent! Very happy with the purchase, had plenty of room for my gear to be placed inside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The tent was easy to set up and kept me warm and dry ...
customer_reviews.text: The tent was easy to set up and kept me warm and dry and away from mosquitoes. The stakes do bend kind of easily so look out for that. Other than that the tent is great for the price and weight.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value and quality
customer_reviews.text: Love the tent spent multiple nights trying it out my only complaint is the included tent pegs. They not super rugged, they're by no means weak it's just that were I'm from the ground is very hard and I bent a few pegs trying to get them in. This is a fixable problem though just need sturdier tent pegs.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: In spite the tent made in China it a very good tent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, easy to set up and take down. Super compact when bagged
customer_reviews.author: Dan Bryan

customer_reviews.title: nice little tent
customer_reviews.text: nice little tent. Bought this for a bike trip from WI to MT. Took up little space, quick set up and tear down and worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Fine tent, easy to setup/take down.
customer_reviews.text: Terrific tent. Used for two outings, so far no problems. Kept a strong wind out as best as it could be expected on a 30 degree F night.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba from Bama

customer_reviews.title: I like the size and weight of it though
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for camping if I ever went backpacking. I haven't used it yet so I can't say how well it works. I like the size and weight of it though.
customer_reviews.author: Ham Radio Operator

customer_reviews.title: Positive reviews were correct!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this a few times now and am very pleased with it. Held up to a short rain storm, stayed dry. Not any faster to set up than a 2 or 3 man tent, but perfect size for hiking or overnight kayak trip.
customer_reviews.author: James Rice

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Plenty of room inside. Able to sit upright inside. No issue with turning around, turning over while inside. Also, even without the rain cover, the mesh screen also cut some of the chill from outside.
customer_reviews.author: S Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Very light
customer_reviews.text: Light and small package for an excellent 1 person solution. Easy to strap on to a backpack. Great color. Slightly darker in reality than the picture. Comes with a repair kit. The poles are curved and made of aluminum. The sakes are also decent aluminum stakes. Worth the money. Amazon has the best price around.
customer_reviews.author: LongtimeAmazonUser

customer_reviews.title: Great tent.
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. First night it rained and I was "snug!" And dry.
customer_reviews.author: James Schaeffer

customer_reviews.title: A must have for solo person camping.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tent. Kept me dry and comfortable on a weekend camping trip. Kept bugs and critters out. Roomier than expected. Was able to keep plenty of gear inside the tent with me.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lynch

customer_reviews.title: so this was perfect for him to pack
customer_reviews.text: son sleep out in the military weekly, so this was perfect for him to pack
customer_reviews.author: Pardonyou

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: good product fast shipping no problem with my order I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Hike & sleep.
customer_reviews.text: I gifted my son. He researches every detail of every product he wants to own. He is extremely pleased with the size and quality.
customer_reviews.author: MLewisK

customer_reviews.title: Great oneman tent
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent oneman tent for solo camping or hiking trips, great for low profile camping , I am very happy with this tent and plan on getting other tents for Snugpak.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Just right.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'11" I fit just right you have go in feet first I love it do recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Moses

customer_reviews.title: Compact but durable
customer_reviews.text: Used this in rain and even snow. It packs light and although it's a bit tight I've been able to fit my jump ruck inside with me also. Great tent.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of kit.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome piece of kit for the field. Easy to set up even in tactical situations, provided you have set it up a few times previously. Really kept in the heat and more than enough room for me and me ruck. I am 6' 2" and had enough room. Recommend this product for sure.
customer_reviews.author: muckle52

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for outdoor camping especially if you’re in the army
customer_reviews.author: Deana Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Built strong, easy to put up and take down. Kept me dry in a rain storm up backpacking. I would buy this tent again if I ever actually need to replace my current one.
customer_reviews.author: Jammin

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Haven't been out yet but on inspection it seems every thing I hoped it would be. Very Nice!!! Loads of xtra stakes, a repair kit. With a little fooling around I think this could serve as a 4season tent!
customer_reviews.author: David Klein

customer_reviews.title: Love the sleeves for the rods much easier than clips
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the smaller footprint. My another backpacking tent is 9 feet long, this one 6 and a half. Love the sleeves for the rods much easier than clips.
customer_reviews.author: stanley siceloff

customer_reviews.title: I really like this tent
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tent. It's easy to put up and lightweight. If the weather is too warm I can leave the fly off and put up a tarp.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: This tent is just great!, it fit me (5'6") and my German Shepard comfortably! Very spacious considering it is a one man tent and takes up very little room! I love this one.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those great values for the money. It's tough, yet compact enough to fit in a backpack. It's a bit heavier than some of the options out there, but not enough to be a deterrent. A great value and will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: FloridaGeek

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Sets up and tears down easy and quick ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Sets up and tears down easy and quick and has enough room in the tent for any gear and sleeping mat you may take with you
customer_reviews.author: Zach L.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I liked the how compact and how easy it was to set up. If you a going to be in a cold & windy area I wouldn’t recommend this might not be the right shelter for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Kerruish

customer_reviews.title: Good tent, could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Would be a lot better if the rain cover were attached in some fashion. It's like setting up the tent twice.
customer_reviews.author: SMH

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit
customer_reviews.text: It’s nice and compact. Quality material. Hard to get in and out of however.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Roberson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tent, don't hesitate on buying it. Just get it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Snugpak, you wouldn't expact anything but quailty.
customer_reviews.text: Snugpak quailty, super small signature/ packing. Nice storage case, easy pack or strap to your pack.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Really awesome solo tent
customer_reviews.text: Really awesome solo tent. Plenty of room on the inside and lightweight for the price. My only gripe is that there are too many damn stakes required to set it up. I had a hard time getting it set up on a somewhat rocky ridge.
customer_reviews.author: head4zhills

customer_reviews.title: Outdoors window.
customer_reviews.text: This unit does exactly what it is designed for. getting in and out is a bit cramped, but it was never the Luxor. Super easy to assemble and break down (before sun up). No issues here.
customer_reviews.author: R. fisher

customer_reviews.title: Awesome piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: I used that tents for weeks under heavy rain always stayed dried in very satisfy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great tent. im 5'7 I fit in it well
customer_reviews.text: great tent. im 5'7 I fit in it well. It is a little hassle getting in or out of it, but its a one man tent so that's what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: This has become my most favorite tent and my number one choice
customer_reviews.text: I am a hard-core outdoors girl. This has become my most favorite tent and my number one choice. Very easy to put up and light weight which is excellent for backpacking
customer_reviews.author: Manu

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Took this tent on a camping trip in the mountains. It poured down rain but everything inside the tent stayed dry. It was easy to set up and break down.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Easy use, amazing shelter.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, easy to pack. This is the best purchase I’ve ever made as a military member and outdoorsman.
customer_reviews.author: Jake & Martha McConville

customer_reviews.title: Best deal of the history of Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the Eberlestock Micro Condo 1-man Tent (which I've used in days long past) at 1,000.00....the Ionosphere may be the best deal in the history of Amazon. I'm not ripping on Eberlestock either...I own a lot of their gear.
customer_reviews.author: @DTOM _1775

customer_reviews.title: Good quality tent
customer_reviews.text: The snugpak Ionosphere tent is light weight durable .I love so much.
customer_reviews.author: Leung wai kwong

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Goes up quickly and easily. It's simple and light. Zipper works well. I like it a lot
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits inside 55 liter pack
customer_reviews.text: Way better than I expected. The ionosphere is compact, lightweight and can even fit inside a 55 liter pack when already fully loaded. I have yet to field test this tent, but when I do I'll come back and update my review. Based on others' experience it should hold its own weight.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Hylan

customer_reviews.title: great  buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Only used it once so far. It held up well to wind and rain and stayed dry inside. It is very light and packable.
customer_reviews.author: FZ1Driver

customer_reviews.title: This tent would be better described as an oversized bivy bag
customer_reviews.text: This tent is very compact definitely a back pack size tent, lightweight. You cannot set up the tent without using the ties to stake it into the ground, the poles are not self supporting. You can use the mosquito netting portion of the tent without the rain fly. The entrance to the tent is somewhat strange, you have to enter through the front of the tent and only unzips halfway down the center. This tent would be better described as an oversized bivy bag. There is no vestibule space as the picture may imply. If you understand how the tent functions you should be pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Used it multiple times during field exercises through multiple weather conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Shauna

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Product is lightweight, portable, easy to set up, and well made. Fits easily into your ruck and keeps you dry and bug free. Also shipped quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle C.

customer_reviews.title: comfortable and dry during the night
customer_reviews.text: Used this past week. Performed exactly as expected in light rain and a moderate wind. Kept me warm, comfortable and dry during the night. Setup and take down takes minutes. Excellent piece of kit.
customer_reviews.author: kori

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tent to blend in with surroundings
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tent to blend in with surroundings. I camped on a hillside above the ocean and felt completely invisible. I will be using this tent on my cross country bicycle trip next year. I am 6' 1" and 220 lbs, I had plenty of room for me and some gear. You can't sit up in it but that is not what it is made for. Worth the money, enjoy!...(several months later). I have used this tent on a lot of trips and have found it to be excellent. It keeps the moister out, I do my camping near the ocean so this is important. It also goes back in it's pack easily.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Akridge

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent equipment! Very well made, and flexible for multi environments.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff A.

customer_reviews.title: Piece of cake to assemble!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to assemble, easy to wash, perfect for one person!
customer_reviews.author: Jason E. B.

customer_reviews.title: It is light easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I have used this 4 years now on deep woods elk hunts in Colorado. It is light easy to set up, just enough room to sleep and keep some of my gear in the tent with me. It handles wind and rain with no issues and does a surprising job keep the warm air in the tent but allowing for good air exchange. I wish the including a loop at the top to hang a glow stick at night. Other than that... you are crazy to buy anything else if you are on the extreme side of the being in the outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Cut4Coach

customer_reviews.title: Slept like I was at home
customer_reviews.text: Used it on a 30mile backpacking trip with situations ranging from cold to windy, warm and mosquito infested. Slept like I was at home.
customer_reviews.author: Peter French

product_meta.title: Snugpak The Ionosphere 1 Man Dome Tent 94" x 39" x 28" Nylon
product_meta.description: The Ionosphere by Snugpak is an extremely small and compact 1 person tent. The Ionosphere has a very low profile and is great for those looking for a 1 person tent to keep out of the elements. Just like The Bunker, the Scorpion 3 and Scorpion 2, the Ionosphere also has a 5000mm PU Coated Fly. The Ionosphere has a single entry point, No-See-Um-Mesh and all seams are seam taped. A very impressive small compact tent by anyone's standard.
feature_bullets: Inner tent dimensions are 94 inches long, 35 inches wide, and 28 inches tall; built to accommodate 1 person and their gear, features tape sealed seams
Lightweight and compact pack size is 19 inches long by 5.5 inches wide; trail weight is 2.64 pounds, pack weight is 3.34 pounds
Equipped with DAC Featherlite NSL anodized aluminum poles with press fit connectors; features No-See-Um mesh mosquito net for warmer climates
Flysheet is 210t polyester RipStop with 5000 millimeter waterproof and windproof polyurethane coating; the 2 pole system keeps condensation buildup to a minimum
A basic repair kit is included; contains metal pole repair sleeve, tent guide rope tensioner, spare cord, elastic loop, patch materials, and a storage bag
Flysheet is a lightweight 210t Polyester Rip Stop up with a 5000mm waterproof polyurethane coating
Inner Tent constructed of 190t Nylon with Polyester Mesh
DAC Feather lite NSL anodized poles with press fit connectors
Comes with a Repair Kit - repairs can be made on the move
